W2025490238:
support
Mechanism: large stem volume and high water content
Organism Context: Madagascar baobab species
Experimental Context: None
Organism: baobab tree
Part of: stem
Strategy: The large, water-filled stems of baobab trees serve a support function by having a high water content, low wood density, high parenchyma content, and living cells beyond 35 cm into the xylem from the cambium.

Experimental Context: scanning electron microscopy (sem) and a new technique-fluorographic dimensional imaging (fdi)-were used to assess the interaction between aqueous droplets and the leaf surfaces of 86 species from 25 genera.
Organism: Bromeliaceae
Part of: the foliar trichome
